title: The name of this rounded "disco" font (has a definite 70s feel to it)
content:
Hi everybody,

I’m new to this community... I’m trying to identify this font here. I haven’t been able yet and I’ve tried Identifont and MyFonts.

Thanks in advance!

Éric de Larochellière

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [orgue-disco3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080201145613/http:/typophile.com/files/orgue-disco3.jpg) | 112.09 KB |

 [‹ Moominvalley In November published 1971](http://web.archive.org/web/20080201145613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40674 "Go to previous forum topic") [Handwritten script for childrens education ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080201145613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40544 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Éric de Laroche...

comments.content: It looks like something by Othmar Motter to me.

Thanks...

I’ve just scanned his works, but the only thing I found that was close was his Motter Femina. I’ll keep looking!
Richard Hards is right, it’s [Motter Ombra](http://web.archive.org/web/20080201145613/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39053), from Othmar Motter.
